title: Isaiah Chapter 46 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Isaiah chapter 46 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Isaiah Chapter 46 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Isaiah Chapter 46.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 46:1, which idols are mentioned as bowing down and stooping?
questions.correctAnswer: Bel and Nebo
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:1 specifically mentions Bel bowing down and Nebo stooping.

questions.question: What burden do the idols carry according to Isaiah 46:1?
options: A heavy load on beasts and cattle
questions.correctAnswer: A heavy load on beasts and cattle
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:1 describes their idols upon beasts and cattle, with their carriages heavily laden as a burden.

questions.question: True or False: According to Isaiah 46:2, the idols could deliver the burden they carried.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:2 states that the idols could not deliver the burden and themselves went into captivity.

questions.question: Who does God call to hearken in Isaiah 46:3?
options: House of Jacob and remnant of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: House of Jacob and remnant of Israel
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:3 clearly addresses the house of Jacob and the remnant of Israel to listen.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 46:4, until when will God carry and bear His people?
options: Even to old age and hoar hairs
Until they reach the promised land
Until the end of the year
questions.correctAnswer: Even to old age and hoar hairs
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:4 says God will carry and bear His people even to their old age and hoar hairs.

questions.question: What question does God ask in Isaiah 46:5?
options: To whom will ye liken me, and make me equal?
Where were you when I laid the foundations?
Why do you forget my commandments?
questions.correctAnswer: To whom will ye liken me, and make me equal?
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:5 contains God's question about who can be compared to Him.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 46:6, what materials are used to make idols?
questions.correctAnswer: Gold and silver
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:6 mentions gold and silver being weighed and used to make gods by a goldsmith.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 46:7 states that idols can hear and answer when called upon.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:7 says that idols cannot answer nor save those who cry unto them.

questions.question: What does Isaiah 46:8 urge transgressors to do?
questions.correctAnswer: Remember and show yourselves men
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:8 calls on transgressors to remember and bring things to mind, showing themselves men.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 46:9, what is unique about God?
options: There is none else like Him
He is the God of the sea
questions.correctAnswer: There is none else like Him
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:9 states God is unique with none else like Him.

questions.question: Complete the verse from Isaiah 46:10: 'Declaring the end from the beginning, and from ancient times the things that are not yet ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: done
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:10 declares God reveals things not yet done from ancient times.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 46:11, what does God call from the east?
questions.correctAnswer: A ravenous bird
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:11 mentions God calling a ravenous bird from the east to execute His counsel.

questions.question: Who does Isaiah 46:12 address as 'stouthearted' and far from righteousness?
questions.correctAnswer: Those who refuse to listen
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:12 calls on the stouthearted who are far from righteousness to hearken.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 46:13 promises that God's salvation will tarry and be delayed.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:13 promises that salvation shall not tarry but will be near.

questions.question: What will God place in Zion according to Isaiah 46:13?
questions.correctAnswer: Salvation for Israel
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:13 says God will place salvation in Zion for Israel, His glory.

medium.title: Isaiah Chapter 46 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Isaiah Chapter 46 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with feeling overwhelmed by life's burdens. Based on Isaiah 46:1-2, what biblical truth would you share to encourage them?
options: Idols are reliable helpers in times of trouble
God carries and supports His people, unlike powerless idols
Heavy burdens are a sign of spiritual failure
We should rely on our own strength to bear burdens
questions.correctAnswer: God carries and supports His people, unlike powerless idols
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:1-2 shows that idols like Bel and Nebo are burdensome and powerless, going into captivity themselves. This contrasts with God's promise to carry and support His people (verses 3-4), teaching us to trust Him rather than idols or self-reliance.

questions.question: How does Isaiah 46:3-4 teach us about God's faithfulness in family life and parenting?
options: God carries us from the womb through old age, showing His lifelong care
Parents should rely on idols to protect their children
God only supports us in our youth
We should carry our own burdens without help
questions.correctAnswer: God carries us from the womb through old age, showing His lifelong care
questions.explanation: Verses 3-4 emphasize God's enduring care from birth to old age, illustrating the importance of trusting God's faithfulness in family and parenting, and modeling lifelong devotion and care.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 46:5, what attitude should Christians have when comparing God to anything else?
options: We should liken God to idols for better understanding
No one can be compared to God because He is unique
We should create new gods to share God's work
God is just one among many equal gods
questions.correctAnswer: No one can be compared to God because He is unique
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:5 asks to whom God can be likened or compared, affirming that no one is equal to Him. This teaches humility and exclusive trust in God's unmatched sovereignty.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to rely on material wealth for security. Based on Isaiah 46:6-7, what biblical truth would you share?
options: Gold and silver idols are reliable sources of help
Idols made by human hands cannot save or answer prayers
questions.correctAnswer: Idols made by human hands cannot save or answer prayers
questions.explanation: Verses 6-7 describe how idols are crafted from gold and silver but cannot move or save those who cry to them. This warns against placing security in material things rather than God.

questions.question: How does Isaiah 46:8 encourage believers to respond when they sin or stray from God's path?
options: Ignore past mistakes and continue as before
Remember God's greatness and repent with courage
Rely on idols to solve problems
questions.correctAnswer: Remember God's greatness and repent with courage
questions.explanation: Verse 8 calls transgressors to remember God and show themselves men by repenting and returning to righteousness, encouraging humility and repentance.

questions.question: What does Isaiah 46:9 teach about God's uniqueness and trustworthiness in times of uncertainty?
options: There are many gods like Him
God is one and unlike any other
questions.correctAnswer: God is one and unlike any other
questions.explanation: Verse 9 stresses God's uniqueness and exclusivity, assuring believers to trust Him alone in uncertainty and trials.

questions.question: A believer is anxious about the future. According to Isaiah 46:10, what truth can bring comfort and encourage faith?
options: God declares the end from the beginning and accomplishes His purposes
The future is unpredictable and uncontrolled
Human plans are more reliable than God's
questions.correctAnswer: God declares the end from the beginning and accomplishes His purposes
questions.explanation: Verse 10 reveals God's sovereign knowledge and control over history, comforting believers that His counsel will stand and His pleasure be done.

questions.question: How does Isaiah 46:11 illustrate God's power to accomplish His plans, even from afar?
options: God calls a ravenous bird from the east to execute His counsel
God requires idols to carry out His will
God depends on human strength alone
questions.correctAnswer: God calls a ravenous bird from the east to execute His counsel
questions.explanation: Verse 11 uses the imagery of a ravenous bird to show God's ability to call and accomplish His plans from distant places, assuring believers of His dependable power.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 46:12 calls those who are far from righteousness to listen and repent.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 12 directly addresses the stouthearted who are far from righteousness, urging them to hearken to God, highlighting the call to repentance.

questions.question: Based on Isaiah 46:13, what promise does God give to encourage steadfast faith and hope?
options: God will bring near His righteousness and salvation without delay
Salvation is only for the righteous now
questions.correctAnswer: God will bring near His righteousness and salvation without delay
questions.explanation: Verse 13 promises that God's righteousness and salvation will not be far off or tarry, encouraging believers to have confident hope and perseverance.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with doubt about God's ability to help in trials. According to Isaiah 46, what practical truth about God’s character can you share?
options: God is powerless in times of difficulty
God has made, carries, and delivers His people throughout life
Idols are more dependable than God
We should depend solely on ourselves
questions.correctAnswer: God has made, carries, and delivers His people throughout life
questions.explanation: Verses 3-4 affirm God's active role in creating, carrying, and delivering His people even in old age, encouraging trust and dependence on Him in trials.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 46 teaches that idols are able to hear prayers and respond to human needs.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:7 explicitly states that idols cannot answer or save those who cry to them, emphasizing their impotence compared to God.

questions.question: How does Isaiah 46:9-10 guide believers in responding to uncertainty about the future?
options: Trust God who declares the end from the beginning and will accomplish His plans
Rely on human plans and ignore God’s counsel
Worry because the future is unknown
Ignore the future and live only for the present
questions.correctAnswer: Trust God who declares the end from the beginning and will accomplish His plans
questions.explanation: Verses 9-10 affirm God's unique sovereignty and foreknowledge, encouraging believers to place their trust in His unchanging plans.

questions.question: A believer is discouraged about their spiritual progress. Based on Isaiah 46:8, what encouragement can you give?
options: Forget past mistakes and continue without change
Remember God’s faithfulness and show courage to repent and grow
questions.correctAnswer: Remember God’s faithfulness and show courage to repent and grow
questions.explanation: Verse 8 encourages transgressors to remember God and show themselves men by repenting and returning to Him, promoting humility and spiritual growth.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Isaiah 46:4 says, "I have made, and I will bear; even I will ______, and will deliver you."
questions.correctAnswer: carry
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:4 promises God will carry and deliver His people, showing His ongoing care and support throughout life.

hard.title: Isaiah Chapter 46 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Isaiah Chapter 46.

questions.question: In Isaiah 46:1, which two idols are described as bowing down and stooping, symbolizing their powerlessness?
questions.correctAnswer: Bel and Nebo
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:1 specifically names Bel and Nebo as the idols that bow down and stoop, highlighting their inability to save or support those who trust in them.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 46:3, who does God address as being 'borne from the belly' and 'carried from the womb'?
options: The house of Jacob and the remnant of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: The house of Jacob and the remnant of Israel
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:3 addresses the house of Jacob and the remnant of Israel, emphasizing God's intimate and ongoing care from birth onward.

questions.question: What is the significance of God's declaration in Isaiah 46:9, 'I am God, and there is none else; I am God, and there is none like me' in the context of Near Eastern polytheism?
options: It asserts monotheism against a polytheistic background
It acknowledges other gods but claims superiority
It calls for the worship of multiple gods
questions.correctAnswer: It asserts monotheism against a polytheistic background
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:9 strongly asserts the uniqueness of God in contrast with the many gods worshiped in the ancient Near East, emphasizing monotheism.

questions.question: Isaiah 46:10 states that God declares 'the end from the beginning.' How does this relate to the biblical theme of God's sovereignty?
options: It shows God’s control over history and fulfillment of prophecy
It reveals God’s ignorance of future events
It suggests fate controls human destiny
It implies that human actions are independent of God
questions.correctAnswer: It shows God’s control over history and fulfillment of prophecy
questions.explanation: The verse emphasizes God’s sovereignty by declaring events before they happen, reinforcing His control over history and the certainty of His plans.

questions.question: What literary device is primarily used in Isaiah 46:6-7 when describing the crafting and worship of idols?
questions.correctAnswer: Irony
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:6-7 employs irony by describing how idols are crafted and then worshiped despite being powerless to answer or save, highlighting their futility.

questions.question: In Isaiah 46:11, what does the imagery of 'calling a ravenous bird from the east' symbolize?
options: The coming of a foreign conqueror carrying out God’s will
The arrival of a natural disaster
A metaphor for Israel’s enemies being destroyed
questions.correctAnswer: The coming of a foreign conqueror carrying out God’s will
questions.explanation: The ravenous bird from the east represents a powerful foreign army or ruler (historically the Babylonians) acting under God’s sovereign plan to execute judgment.

questions.question: Isaiah 46:4 says, 'even to your old age I am he; and even to hoar hairs will I carry you.' How does this foreshadow the New Testament concept of God’s enduring care?
options: It prefigures Christ’s lifelong shepherding of believers
It contrasts with the New Testament’s focus on youth
It limits God’s care to old age only
It denies God’s involvement in daily life
questions.correctAnswer: It prefigures Christ’s lifelong shepherding of believers
questions.explanation: This verse anticipates the New Testament theme of Jesus as the Good Shepherd who lovingly cares for His flock throughout their lives (e.g., John 10).

questions.question: True or False: According to Isaiah 46:7, the idols can move from their place and respond to those who call upon them.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:7 clearly states that the idol 'standeth; from his place shall he not remove' and cannot answer or save anyone, reflecting their impotence.

questions.question: The phrase 'Remember the former things of old' in Isaiah 46:9 is an example of what type of prophetic technique?
questions.correctAnswer: Historical allusion
questions.explanation: This phrase calls the audience to recall past acts of God as proof of His unique identity and power, a common prophetic technique to validate future promises.

questions.question: In Isaiah 46:12, the term 'stouthearted' most closely refers to which characteristic?
questions.correctAnswer: Proud and stubborn in sin
questions.explanation: The Hebrew term translated as 'stouthearted' denotes those who are proud, stubborn, and resistant to righteousness, as indicated by the context in verse 12.

questions.question: Which theme in Isaiah 46 is developed further in the New Testament book of Hebrews regarding God’s faithfulness?
options: God’s unchanging nature and care from birth to old age
The establishment of the Davidic monarchy
questions.correctAnswer: God’s unchanging nature and care from birth to old age
questions.explanation: Hebrews emphasizes God’s faithfulness and unchanging nature, paralleling Isaiah 46:4’s affirmation of God’s lifelong support and care.

questions.question: What is the primary contrast drawn in Isaiah 46:1-2 between the idols and God?
options: Idols are burdensome and captive; God bears and delivers
Idols are powerful and liberating; God is silent
God is an idol; idols are living gods
Idols and God both save equally
questions.correctAnswer: Idols are burdensome and captive; God bears and delivers
questions.explanation: Verses 1-2 contrast the idols’ inability to bear burdens and their captivity with God’s active role in carrying and delivering His people.

questions.question: How does Isaiah 46:13 connect the theme of salvation with Zion?
options: It proclaims salvation will be established in Zion as God’s glory
It states Zion will be destroyed, ending salvation
It links salvation exclusively to Gentile nations
It denies any future salvation for Israel
questions.correctAnswer: It proclaims salvation will be established in Zion as God’s glory
questions.explanation: Verse 13 emphasizes God’s promise to place salvation in Zion, highlighting it as the locus of His glory and redemptive work.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Isaiah 46:5: 'To whom will ye liken me, and make me equal, and compare me, that we may be like?' This rhetorical question emphasizes God's ________.
questions.correctAnswer: uniqueness
questions.explanation: The question in verse 5 underscores God's uniqueness by challenging the idea of comparing Him to any idol or god.

questions.question: How does the imagery of idols being 'upon the beasts' and 'upon the cattle' in Isaiah 46:1 reflect the ancient Near Eastern context?
options: It shows idols were carried in processions on animals, indicating religious practices
It means idols fed the animals
It implies animals worshipped the idols
It suggests idols were made of animal parts
questions.correctAnswer: It shows idols were carried in processions on animals, indicating religious practices
questions.explanation: This imagery reflects the historical practice of transporting idols on animals during religious ceremonies, highlighting their physical and cultural context.

theological.title: Isaiah Chapter 46 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Isaiah Chapter 46 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What does Isaiah 46:1 describe about the idols Bel and Nebo?
options: They bow down and are a burden to the beasts
They deliver the people from captivity
questions.correctAnswer: They bow down and are a burden to the beasts
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:1 describes Bel and Nebo as bowing down and stooping, their idols being a heavy burden on beasts. This illustrates the impotence of idols. Similar themes about the futility of idols appear in Psalm 115:4-8 and Jeremiah 10:5, emphasizing God's unique power unlike idols. Acts 17:29-31 contrasts living God with lifeless idols.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 46:4, what assurance does God give to His people?
options: He will carry them even to old age and hoary hairs
He will abandon them in their old age
He will only protect them during their youth
He will judge them without mercy
questions.correctAnswer: He will carry them even to old age and hoary hairs
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:4 promises God’s sustaining care throughout life, even to old age. This reflects God’s covenantal faithfulness, as also seen in Psalm 71:18 and Deuteronomy 31:6. The New Testament echoes this in Hebrews 13:5 and Matthew 28:20, confirming God's continual presence and care.

questions.question: In Isaiah 46:5, what challenge does God pose regarding His uniqueness?
options: To whom will you liken me or make me equal?
Who can defeat me in battle?
Where can you find my temple?
questions.correctAnswer: To whom will you liken me or make me equal?
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:5 challenges the readers to find an equal or likeness to God, affirming His incomparability. This is consistent with Exodus 15:11 and Isaiah 40:25, stressing God's uniqueness. Paul in Romans 1:25 addresses idolatry of created things versus the Creator.

questions.question: What process do people use to create idols according to Isaiah 46:6?
options: Lavishing gold, weighing silver, and hiring a goldsmith
Praying and fasting for divine guidance
questions.correctAnswer: Lavishing gold, weighing silver, and hiring a goldsmith
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:6 describes the human effort to make idols by using precious metals and craftsmen, highlighting man-made gods versus the living God. This echoes Psalm 135:15-18 and Jeremiah 10:3-5 on the folly of idols. Acts 19:24-27 also shows the economic and spiritual futility of idol worship.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 46:7, what is the limitation of idols when one calls upon them?
options: They cannot answer or save from trouble
They come down from their place to help
questions.correctAnswer: They cannot answer or save from trouble
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:7 states that idols cannot respond or deliver those who call on them, underscoring their helplessness. This matches Psalm 115:4-7 and Habakkuk 2:18-19, which portray idols as powerless. In contrast, God hears and saves as seen in Psalm 34:17 and 2 Timothy 4:18.

questions.question: Who is Isaiah addressing in Isaiah 46:3 when he says 'Hearken unto me'?
options: The house of Jacob and the remnant of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: The house of Jacob and the remnant of Israel
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:3 calls the house of Jacob and all Israel’s remnant to listen, emphasizing God’s ongoing relationship with His covenant people. This is consistent with God's promises to Israel in Jeremiah 31:31-34 and Romans 11:1-5 about the faithful remnant.

questions.question: What divine attribute is highlighted in Isaiah 46:9 when God says 'I am God, and there is none else'?
questions.correctAnswer: God’s uniqueness and exclusivity
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:9 stresses God's exclusive deity and uniqueness, foundational to monotheism. This aligns with Deuteronomy 6:4, Isaiah 45:5, and Malachi 2:10. The New Testament affirms this in 1 Corinthians 8:6 and John 17:3.

questions.question: What does Isaiah 46:10 reveal about God's knowledge and sovereignty?
options: He declares the end from the beginning and will accomplish His counsel
He is uncertain about the future
He lets humans decide their destiny
questions.correctAnswer: He declares the end from the beginning and will accomplish His counsel
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:10 shows God's foreknowledge and sovereign plan, affirming His control over history. This is consistent with Psalm 33:11 and Proverbs 19:21. The New Testament reiterates this in Romans 8:28 and Ephesians 1:11.

questions.question: Who is the 'ravenous bird from the east' mentioned in Isaiah 46:11 symbolic of?
options: The man executing God's counsel from a far country
questions.correctAnswer: The man executing God's counsel from a far country
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:11 uses the ravenous bird as a metaphor for a person God calls to fulfill His plan from afar. This likely refers to Cyrus (Isaiah 45:1) and God's use of foreign rulers. This typology shows God's control over nations as in Daniel 4:17 and Acts 17:26.

questions.question: In Isaiah 46:13, what does God say He will place in Zion?
questions.correctAnswer: Salvation for Israel, His glory
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:13 promises God’s salvation and glory placed in Zion, revealing His redemptive purpose for Israel. This messianic hope is echoed in Psalm 98:2, Isaiah 12:2, and Luke 2:30-32. It emphasizes God's eschatological plan for restoration.

questions.question: How does Isaiah 46:2 describe the fate of the idols and those who rely on them?
options: They bow down together and go into captivity
questions.correctAnswer: They bow down together and go into captivity
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:2 describes idols and their worshippers as powerless, bowing down and taken captive. This indicates the futility of idolatry, consonant with Jeremiah 2:11 and Habakkuk 2:18. It warns of judgment on those who trust in false gods.

questions.question: What is the meaning of 'Remember the former things of old' in Isaiah 46:9?
options: Recall God's past acts to understand His sovereignty
Forget past events and focus on the future
Ignore history and trust human wisdom
questions.correctAnswer: Recall God's past acts to understand His sovereignty
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:9 calls Israel to remember God's historic deeds as proof of His sovereignty and uniqueness. This theme appears in Exodus 20:2-3 and Deuteronomy 7:18. Jesus also reminds His followers of God’s faithfulness in John 14:9.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 46:12, who is being addressed with the command to hearken unto God?
options: The stouthearted who are far from righteousness
questions.correctAnswer: The stouthearted who are far from righteousness
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:12 calls the proud and unrighteous to listen to God, inviting repentance. This contrasts with the humble, as seen in Proverbs 16:18 and Luke 18:14. It highlights the need for turning from sin to receive God's salvation.

questions.question: What theological truth is conveyed by God's statement in Isaiah 46:3 about carrying His people from the womb?
options: God’s intimate and sovereign care from conception onward
questions.correctAnswer: God’s intimate and sovereign care from conception onward
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:3 emphasizes God's personal involvement with His people from the womb, affirming divine providence and election. This parallels Psalm 139:13-16 and Jeremiah 1:5. It underscores God's covenantal relationship and care.

questions.question: How does Isaiah 46:8 exhort the people to respond to God's message?
options: Remember and show yourselves men by repenting
Ignore the message and continue sinning
questions.correctAnswer: Remember and show yourselves men by repenting
questions.explanation: Isaiah 46:8 calls the transgressors to remember God’s truth and act responsibly by repenting. This call to spiritual maturity aligns with Ezekiel 18:30 and Acts 17:30. It stresses human accountability before God.
